page.title: 05A shepherd's Work-Powburn
page.content: As well as lambing, dipping and dressing sheep for shows and the September breeding sales, a lot of other work is done through the year. Sheep have to be dozed and their feet clipped. They have to be injected for all different kinds of diseases. Hay has to be got in for their Winter feed.Sheds are prepared to bring sheep into for the Winter - though not all farms around here do this. Wool is clipped and wrapped. Sheepdog training starts at about six months old. The trainer aims to get basic obedience to start with. Then it all depends on the dog how long the training takes. Some dogs are quick and you can have them running at one yearold. Other dogs it takes until they are two or three years old before they are any good. Sheepdog trials start in May and finish in October.
